name: Barnet Gate Mill
condition: Well maintained external appearance, with 4 sails. Not open to the public.

name: Ashby's Mill
condition:
Subject to an extensive restoration in early 2011 and now regularly open to the public.
      New visitor centre being constructed 2019-2020.

name: Clerkenwell
condition: truncated tower, within the waterworks site

name: Erith
condition: part of the roundhouse wall, incorporated into a general boundary wall

name: Keston
condition: conserved, occasionally open to the public

name: Mitcham Common
condition: bare trestle remains, previously deteriorating rapidly, but now stabilized

name: Common Mill
condition: converted, providing accomodation above the Old Mill pub

name: Shirley
condition: restored and open to the public

name: Crane Park Mill
condition: Used as a nature and visitor centre by the London Wildlife Trust

name: Common Mill
condition: small mill, for pumping - no sails remaining

name: Wimbledon
condition: Much altered from its working appearance. Now a milling museum and regularly open.
